headline: Stellantis takes drastic action to right the ship
summary: Auto tariffs have made 2025 an unusual year for U.S. auto giants. Take Ford F, for instance. The Blue Oval leaned heavily into promotions to drive sales as consumers, concerned about the effect the 25% tariffs would have on prices, flocked to dealerships to purchase their vehicles before ...

headline: Trump's trade war could cost automakers around the world $30B
summary: President Trump's trade wars could cost global automakers up to $30 billion in combined profit, according to a report from Moody's Ratings. Yahoo Finance senior autos reporter Pras Subramanian assesses this report's findings on how the Trump administration's tariffs will weigh on auto company's operating margins. Also check out Yahoo Finance's full interviews with Ford (F) CEO Jim Farley and General Motors (GM) Buick and GMC global vice president Jaclyn McQuaid. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: This Week In Electric Vehicles - Nayax Partners With ChargeSmart To Advance Payment Solutions
summary: Nayax Ltd. has announced a strategic partnership with ChargeSmart EV, one of the rapidly expanding EV charging networks in the United States, to enhance accessibility and convenience in EV charging infrastructure. This collaboration designates Nayax as ChargeSmart's preferred provider of cashless payment solutions, involving a long-term agreement to roll out numerous new DC fast chargers. headline: Bidirectional Charging Market worth $844.1 million by 2035 | MarketsandMarkets™
summary: The global market for bidirectional charging market is projected to grow from USD 70.0 million in 2025 to USD 844.1 million by 2035, at a CAGR of 28.3%, according to a new report by MarketsandMarkets™. The global bidirectional charging market is gaining strong traction, led by the widespread deployment of V2L features in passenger vehicles and growing V2H deployment for home energy backup. V2L has emerged as the most common use case, allowing users to power external devices easily and at low cos

headline: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: GoldenEye
summary: Goldman Sachs analysts forecast the metal will hit $4,900 by the end of next year, driven by central banks in emerging markets, which “are likely to continue the structural diversification of their reserves into gold.”  The Wall Street Journal reported that a fire severely damaged an aluminum plant in Oswego, N.Y., knocking a major portion of it offline until next year.  Back pay for federal workers may not be guaranteed.

Back pay for federal workers may not be guaranteed.

headline: Tariffs and EV Incentive Changes Could Be a Game Changer for Ford Motor (F)
summary: In recent days, Ford Motor has faced heightened scrutiny as the US administration introduced new tariffs on imported medium- and heavy-duty trucks and the federal US$7,500 EV tax credit expired, both of which may impact the company’s cost structure and electric vehicle demand. At the same time, Ford’s recognition for its hybrid offerings and a flexible approach to changing emissions and trade policies has drawn industry and analyst attention as the market reassesses its product strategy. A...
